org.jpws.data

Interface PWDatabase


  • public interface PWDatabase
    Not used in this release.

    • Method Detail

      • getRecord

        PWDB_RecordHandle getRecord(int recID,
                            java.lang.String modus)
        Retrieves a record from this database and returns a handle for read and write operations. The requested record must exist prior to the call. This function performs record locking on the database according to the IO modus requested and will notify the caller about impossible access through exception thrown.
        Parameters:
        recID - a valid record number
        modus - specifies the IO access modus that will be enabled by the handle. Values are: "r" for read-only access, "rw" for read/write access.
        Throws:
        org.jpws.pwslib.exception.NoSuchRecordException
        RecordInUseException
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

      • newRecord

        PWDB_RecordHandle newRecord()

      • deleteRecord

        void deleteRecord(int recID)

      • iterator

        java.util.Iterator<java.lang.Integer> iterator()
        Returns an Iterator over all records in this database. The returned values are record identifiers in the form of Integer objects.
        Returns:
        iterator on element type Integer

      • size

        int size()
        The number of records in this database. This value is identical with the cardinality of the set of records that is returned by the iterator() .

      • close

        void close()
        Closes this database and makes any further IO access impossible. The persistent file should be released from any file lockings.

      • remove

        boolean remove()
        Attempts to remove the persistent file of this database. By convention this will only work if this database is closed.
        Returns:
        true if and only if the file does not exist after finish of this routine

      • flush

        void flush()
        Writes any pending changes to the database and attempts to create a consistent persistent file when the routine finishes.

      • clear

        void clear()
        Removes all records from this database

      • rename

        boolean rename(java.lang.String filename)
        Attempts to rename the filename of this database. Does not work for path relocations.
        Returns:
        true if and only if the rename was successful

      • copyTo

        void copyTo(java.net.URL url)
        Creates a copy of this database at the given location.
        Parameters:
        url -

      • getProperty

        java.lang.String getProperty(java.lang.String name)
        Returns property settings for this database. This may be used to determine supported features from a canon of database features. For boolean type properties the values "true" or "false" are returned.
        Parameters:
        name -
        Returns:
        the property expression active for the given name or null if the property is unknown

      • setProperty

        void setProperty(java.lang.String name,
                 java.lang.String value)
        Sets the value of a modifiable property of this databse.
        Parameters:
        name - name of the property to be set
        value - value to be assigned to the property

      • isActiveFeature

        boolean isActiveFeature(java.lang.String name)
        Returns true on a given value x if getProperty(x) returns "true" and false in any other case.
        Parameters:
        name - property to be tested
        Returns:
        whether the given property is active in this database
